babble.net

Class NioServer<R extends Request,P extends Response>

  • java.lang.Object
    • babble.net.NioServer<R,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpServer, JSONRPCServer

    public abstract class NioServer<R extends Request,P extends Response>
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A server for asynchronous network based request-response processing. The server receives request over a network channel and produces a response on the same channel. The request is not blocked in the sense that caller will receive the response in a separate thread and hence the calling thread can processed while the request being processed by the server.

    The server employs asynchronous behavior at two levels:

    • The server listens to incoming requests over a socket. The server is not blocked on network i/o on listening for incoming requests but are called by underlying operating system when a request arrives (via selector). This is the first level of asynchronous behavior.
    • The incoming requests are handed over to a dispatcher which executes requests in separate request-processing thread instead of the server thread. This is the second level of asynchronous behavior.
      Whenever a request has been processed, the response is posted back to the server and server thread sends the response back to original remote client. Hence remote i/o i.e. reading request and writing response to remote client happens on same 'main' server thread.
    From a client's perspective, it sends a request over socket and server responds on the same socket whenever the request is ready.
    This server does not interpret the incoming request. A router defines the behavior to interpret the incoming request by a definite protocol such as HTTP.
    Author:
    pinaki poddar

    • Constructor Detail

      • NioServer

        protected NioServer(String serverName,
                    int port,
                    Protocol<R,P> protocol)
        Creates a server to listen for incoming connection requests on the given port. The given protocol determines the type of request and response.
        Parameters:
        serverName - a name to describe this server.
        port - a port to listen for incoming request
        protocol - protocol used by this server
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • geProtocol

        public final Protocol<R,P> geProtocol()

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets a logical name of this server.

      • addRoute

        public void addRoute(Route<R,P> route)
        Adds given route to this server. A route is invoked it matches a request. A server requires at least one route to function.
        Parameters:
        route - a route to be processed
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no router has been set.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IllegalStateException,
                  IOException
        Starts this server. Stars two threads: 'main' server thread runs continuously for network i/o and a 'router' thread that processes the routes.
        Throws:
        IOException - if listening channel can not be opened
        IllegalStateException - if no route has been defined

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs continually to accept request from and send response to remote clients.
        Checks via a selector when an incoming request arrives or a response is ready to be sent.
        If one or more selection key registered with the selector are ready for i/o operation, then the attachment with the selected key carries the request or response as the case may be. In this manner, separate request/response queue are not necessary to be maintained. The selection key itself is attached with the data to be operated, the operation i.e. read or write and the socket to use to send or receive the data.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • processResponse

        public void processResponse(P response)

      • getProtocol

        public Protocol<R,P> getProtocol()
        Returns the protocol.

      • getURL

        public String getURL()
        gets a URL to reach this server. The URL at this network level server specify [protocol://]host:port where protocol is supplied by the router, if it is attached.
        Returns:
        a base URL for this network server.

      • setExecutionContext

        public void setExecutionContext(ExecutionContext ctx)
        Sets the execution context. Typically this server is its own execution context, but there can be scenarios where the routes execute in different context that provides additional features/services.
        Parameters:
        ctx - an execution context. Must not be null.

      • getExecutionContext

        public ExecutionContext getExecutionContext()
        Sets an execution context. All routes registered with this server will execute in this given execution context.
        Returns:
        a context. Never null.

        public org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
